legibleDescription.textElement:
The Functional Profiles enable a controller to set a current limitation for an Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE).

The charging station's current limit is dynamically regulated by an external Energy Management System (EMS), with the value expressed in amps.

This specific parameter is designed to be easily adjusted by an Energy Manager, allowing for efficient and tailored control of the charging process.

The mandatory data point EMSCurrentLimit enable real-time monitoring and control of the consumption limit of the charging station.

The SmoothTransition datapoints are utilized to specify the transition process following the reception of a new limit value by the charging station.

This functional profile can be utilized in conjunction with the EVSE States functional profile.

Die Funktionsprofile ermöglichen es einem Controller, eine Strombegrenzung für ein Electric Vehicle Supply Equipment (EVSE) festzulegen.

Die Strombegrenzung der Ladestation wird dynamisch durch ein externes Energiemanagementsystem (EMS) geregelt, mit dem in Ampere ausgedrückten Wert.

Dieser spezifische Parameter kann von einem Energiemanager einfach angepasst werden und ermöglicht so eine effiziente und maßgeschneiderte Steuerung des Ladevorgangs.

Der obligatorische Datenpunkt EMSCurrentLimit ermöglicht eine Echtzeitüberwachung und Steuerung der Verbrauchsgrenze der Ladestation.

Die SmoothTransition-Datenpunkte werden verwendet, um den Übergangsprozess nach dem Empfang eines neuen Grenzwerts durch die Ladestation zu spezifizieren.

Dieses Funktionsprofil kann in Verbindung mit dem Funktionsprofil EVSE States verwendet werden.

The maximum current allowed for the charging station at this moment.

If the device requires different datapoints for writing and reading, the data direction of this data point can be changed to W and the data point EMSCurrentLimitFeedback can be used to define a datapoint for reading the maximum current.
Current limit ...

Sub datapoint defining the window for the smooth transition of the EMSCurrentLimit datapoint.

Indicates a time window in which the new operating mode is started randomly. The time window begins with the start command of the operating mode. The value 0 means immediate.

This datapoint can be implemented in the device as constant datapoint if the value is constant or as regular datapoint if it can be read from the device.

See winTms in Smooth Transition
Current limit ...

Sub datapoint defining the delay for the smooth transition of the EMSCurrentLimit datapoint.

Specifies how quickly the changes should be made. The corresponding value is gradually changed from the old to the new value in the specified time.

This datapoint can be implemented in the device as constant datapoint if the value is constant or as regular datapoint if it can be read from the device.

See rmpTms in Smooth Transition
Current limit ...

Sub datapoint defining the duration for the smooth transition of the EMSCurrentLimit datapoint.

determines how long the operating mode should be active. When the time has elapsed, the operating mode is automatically terminated. If set to 0 (standard value), the operating mode remains active until a new command is received.

This datapoint can be implemented in the device as constant datapoint if the value is constant or as regular datapoint if it can be read from the device.

See rvrtTms in Smooth Transition
Current limit ...

Reads the maximum current allowed for the charging station at this moment.

This datapoint should only be used if the devices requires different datapoints to write and to read the maximum current.
Current limit ...

In the event of a communication interruption with the EMS, the EVSE automatically adjusts its current limit to the Safe Current value.

If the device requires different datapoints for writing and reading, the data direction of this data point can be changed to W and the data point SafeCurrentFeedback can be used to define a datapoint for reading the safe current.

This datapoint should only be used if the devices requires different datapoints to write and to read the safe current.
Zum Einstellen des Betriebsmodus

Sub datapoint defining the window for the smooth transition of the SafeCurrent datapoint.

Indicates a time window in which the new operating mode is started randomly. The time window begins with the start command of the operating mode. The value 0 means immediate.

This datapoint can be implemented in the device as constant datapoint if the value is constant or as regular datapoint if it can be read from the device.

See winTms in Smooth Transition
Window zum Einstellen des Betriebsmodus

Sub datapoint defining the delay for the smooth transition of the SafeCurrent datapoint.

Specifies how quickly the changes should be made. The corresponding value is gradually changed from the old to the new value in the specified time.

This datapoint can be implemented in the device as constant datapoint if the value is constant or as regular datapoint if it can be read from the device.

See rmpTms in Smooth Transition
Delay zum Einstellen des Betriebsmodus

Sub datapoint defining the duration for the smooth transition of the SafeCurrent datapoint.

determines how long the operating mode should be active. When the time has elapsed, the operating mode is automatically terminated. If set to 0 (standard value), the operating mode remains active until a new command is received.

This datapoint can be implemented in the device as constant datapoint if the value is constant or as regular datapoint if it can be read from the device.

See rvrtTms in Smooth Transition
Duration zum Einstellen des Betriebsmodus

Reads the current limit to the Safe Current value.

This datapoint should only be used if the devices requires different datapoints to write and to read the safe current.
Zum Lesen des Betriebsmodus

The MaxReceiveTimeSec datapoint signifies the timeout for the stability fallback. If the EVSE does not receive communication within the specified MaxReceiveTimeSec', it will automatically limit the current to the SafeCurrent value.

If the device requires different datapoints for writing and reading, the data direction of this data point can be changed to W and the data point MaxReceiveTimeSecFeedback can be used to define a datapoint for reading the timeout.

This datapoint should only be used if the devices requires different datapoints to write and to read the timeout.
Timeout ...

Reads the timeout for the stability fallback.

This datapoint should only be used if the devices requires different datapoints to write and to read the timeout.
Timeout ...
The maximum current allowed for the EVSE is determined by the electrical installation of the charging station and cannot be changed during operation.
Hardware current limit ...
